course_title: Special Topics: The Self in Performance
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 4Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as HLTH 385 1)
This course will introduce self-revelatory performance, a technique in which participants create an original performance piece that depicts the "working through" of a recent life challenge using drama therapy techniques. The course will include the history of the method's practice, foundational theories and principles, various approaches used, and an exploration of the technique's effect on human health and wellness. In addition to traditional lecture, classes will involve learning through participation in drama therapy warm-ups, techniques, and processing. As the course is primarily experiential, it is crucial that students attend regularly and participate in activities and group discussions. No previous training in theatre or drama therapy is necessary.
